data.communities:
will be in comp.lang.perl.modules source currently being developed
    at http://sourceforge.net/projects/lnetworker
data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
As far as i can see the modules used for interfacing to and
    supporting commercial software appear to placed as a root namespace.

    Why is it called NSR - this is for historical reasons. All the
    command line binaries are of the form nsr?????

    Modules currently under devlopment include * NSR::Server *
    NSR::Client * NSR::Jukebox * NSR::Device * NSR::Directive *
    NSR::Group * NSR::Pool * NSR::Schedule * NSR::Stage * NSR::Tape *
    NSR::Util Do i have to register these individually?

    The intention is to produce a bundle as well as the individual
    modules
